Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: jimbo657
Reviews.Content: its a bit out of the way but perfect for the Nou Camp, good 4* suites, great staff and excellent facilities, its in a strange residential area next to Barcelona main hospital so the local bars/restaurants attract a eclectic clientele but would highly recommend the place

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dotz07
Reviews.Content: Modern spacious apartments. It's ideal for the independent traveller. Bus 46 from the airport takes you to the hotel.....just stop off at the hospital. If using the Metro, it's at the begining/end of the L1 line (depending on where you're coming from) and trains arrive every 1.5 mins.Both the Fira Suites and Hotel have a courtesy bus to the city centre and airport. Times given at check in, plus maps of the city. Bought the Barcelona Card (costs about 6 Euros per day). Used it on trams, buses and metro. A big shopping centre is only about 10 mins away. Very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff. Downsides No kettles in rooms. Extra charges for late check out. The subway. Despite the downsides, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably an excellent conference hotel. Not really a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frankieandcharl
Reviews.Content: Unless you actually want to stay near the airport or you come for a conference (or you come during the MWC in February and that's the only proper hotel left), you would be forgiven to give this one a pass. The 25+ storey modern (and ugly) building in this council block flat area may look like a very odd choice for a stay in Barcelona. Like everywhere in Spain there is an immense inflation on the number of stars these hotels give themselves. This one is a "5 star"...let's call it a decent 3 star hotel and you will reset the baseline where it should be. Comfortable rooms (although badly finished), very nice staff and good breakfast will make it it a decent stay for business trips. The gym nearby is superb, so is the pool, but be ready to pay a hefty 12 euros fee for a swim..and you will be reminded intensely that you should have packed your swimming hat. Of course. The management is too uptight, leaving the staff with no other option that regretfully charging for silly extras like the 15euros/hour silly late check out...

Reviews.Title: “Large modern suites, good value”
Reviews.Author: Electriques
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a large, two building very modern complex. The suite itself was very spacious - separate living and sleeping areas and included a living room, kitchenette, bedroom and bathroom (you might want to bring your own Kleenex though - we got a little pack of 5 every couple of days). The room was clean, quiet and modern. The metro stop is located by the hospital and is about a 5 minute walk (as others have said though, you do have to walk through a deserted parking lot if you come back late at night). The metro ride downtown is about 30 minutes and I would get a pass if staying for several days. There is a free shuttle to the airport. If I was parking a car I would double check the parking rates - posted rates in the garage were 24 euros/day (we had a rental car we returned after one night) but we were not billed (you have to get a pass for the garage from the hotel). Free wi-fi was available throughout the hotel. There is a nice grocery/shopping spot tucked away close by - about a 5 minute walk. We did not eat at the hotel - it was expensive. I would certainly recommend if you did not mind the distance from the downtown area. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: bolovesjoe
Reviews.Content: We spent three days in Barcelona before our cruise and one day when it was over. This hotel was lovely and the staff was very helpful. All at the front desk speak English (though the rest of the staff - including the shuttle drivers - do not). We loved the rooms - they were very clean and well-equipped. As mentioned, it is positioned outside the heart of the city, but we did enjoy the neighborhood surrounding the hotel. The Cafe 365 serves great coffee, pastries and sandwiches and is even open on Sundays. We also ate around the corner at La Flama and had a good experience there for very little money (hamburgers on baguettes were about 3 euros and they make the best pan con tomato we had in Spain). The metro is close and cheap and we used it a lot - it's also very easy to figure out the routes. The shuttle at the hotel doesn't run very often, but it's nice if you can catch it. We actually booked this hotel because of the free airport shuttle, but it was never running when we needed it so we took taxis which are easily available and run about $25 euros. The shuttle also doesn't work for going to the cruise port - you need a cab for that as well. Overall, I felt this hotel was a good choice and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with some Minor Inconvenience”
Reviews.Author: ronc41
Reviews.Content: Exceptional value for a suite--nice sitting area, well-equipped kitchenette, comfortable bedroom, and absolutely amazing shower. We booked both for the value and to be near the airport. A 25-minute Metro ride (station very near to hotel) gets you just about anywhere you might want to go in Barcelona. The biggest downside to this property is that, unless you want to fork out big bucks (or big euros) to eat in the hotel's restaurants, you're going to be pretty hungry. There are NO restaurants nearby--just a kebab place, a sandwich shop, and a small grocer. The nearby hospital has a cafeteria, but its hours aren't convenient. One solution is to eat a big midday meal in Madrid and then a sandwich or kebab in the evening. You should also note that the hotel does not have an airport shuttle. Even though it is very close to the airport, our taxi cost us over 20 euros, which we found shockingly excessive. (Actually, since we were at the end of our trip and dumping our euros, I barely had enough to pay the driver.) It had cost us only 11 euros to get from the train station to the hotel, a much longer trip.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robinsrule
Reviews.Content: If you want to be located in the middle of town, this is not the place for you. However, we saved at least €30 a night by booking here, and for three days the Metro journey into town and back each day wasn’t a problem for us. Plusses are that there is a free airport shuttle (although the scheduled times are loose to say the least), friendly staff who speak good English, and a fabulous breakfast in the Hesperia Tower next door. Note that if you check in late or at the weekend you will have to use the reception in the tower. The Metro is a 5 minute walk away, although as other have noted you will be getting off a practically deserted train as the hotel is at the last stop. The car park is well lit though, and we didn’t see any dodgy characters around. As we were constantly hopping on and off the Metro, we bought a three day card which worked out at a reasonable €5.50 per day. The only issues we had were that there was a funny smell around, although this seemed to be a general problem of the area, and not just our room. I think it was coming from the sewage system, and with our room window open it didn’t unduly bother us. It also felt like we were the only guests in our block – great if you want peace and quiet but slightly disconcerting nonetheless. The rooms were well equipped, although with marble floors and no rugs we could have done with a cheap pair of hotel slippers. The shower also requires a science degree to turn on! As other have commented, the bathrooms are dark – didn’t bother me, but my wife struggled with her makeup. Also, the cleaning ladies were noisy in the mornings as they chatted in the corridor. We were already up and about but it would have been annoying if I was trying to lie in! All in all we don’t have any complaints considering what a bargain the hotel was. If it’s luxury or a central location you are after, look elsewhere, but if value-for-money and access to the airport are top of the list then you are on to a winner (it looks easy to drive to too, right off the motorway – though give driving in town a miss, I have made that mistake before!). The Hesperia Tower next door looked great if the reception and restaurant are anything to go by, although it is definitely more of a conference than a tourist hotel. One quick tip: Book your Sagrada Familia tickets online at least a day before to save yourself a two hour queue when you are there! You’ll need a credit card, a printer, and someone who speaks Spanish to help you though….

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, roomy”
Reviews.Author: Rene B
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our visit to Barcelona. We stayed 4 days. It is outside of the city, but 5 minutes away from a subway station. I preferred riding the subway 30 minutes to parking downtown! We really enjoyed our room, the amenities. It is a tad noisy in the morning, with the cleaning staff out and about. All and all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport but far from the center of Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: adrandlkj
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 day post cruise. Didn't realize it was far from Placa Catalunya. Took their shuttle to the city center and rode the train back to the hotel (about 10 min. walk fr the train station). We also didn't know that we can't check in directly at the suites reception on weekends. We had to carry our bags to the Hesperia tower front desk to do it. Also, our booking said check in was at 12 noon, but when we got there no rooms were available until 3 PM. We liked the size of the suite and the fully equipped kitchen. The bathroom tiles (floor and walls) were all black, which was just too much for our taste. The shower drain didn't work well so standing in a pool of water on black tiles made our feet crawl! Couldn't wait to jump out of the shower and wash our feet somewhere....

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel to go with family especially young children”
Reviews.Author: OLU A
Reviews.Content: The hotel location to the airport is excellent. The staffs are all very helpful and most of them speak English which was very useful. The hotel operates shuttle bus to the city center and also to the airport, but you need to plan ahead to know what time the bus departs to each of this locations. Even though it is far from the city center, the train station is just about 5 mins walk away so it is very easy to get to town. The breakfast is fabulous and the staff in the restaurant are all very helpful. The suites is a proper apartment for a family as the kitchen is fully equipped. I was surprised at how fully equipped the kitchenette was. It was easy preparing a proper meals for my kids because there is a mini shopping area round the corner from the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel and come back again. It is very clean and the beds are comfortable. Getting around is very easy. Any one staying for more than one day should buy the metro train ticket in bulk as you can buy from 2 to 5 days worth of ticket at ones as this saves lots of money.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard98335
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because they were rated 5 stars and they also highly advertised their 5 star rating. Across the board I would give them a 3 at best and that is because I am being nice. Rooms were dirty, counters and table were not even wiped off. Paint and wallpaper peeling off wall. Hallways had no airconditioning. Hotel was in a poorer part of town, we saw physical fights, panhandlers, and generally we did not feel safe. We had luggage stolen from us while we were standing right next to it right in front of the hotel. Hotel told us the police would not do anything because there was no violence involved. When I checked in our luggage they left it sit up against the wall right next to the door. After 45 min. I expressed my concern and was told that they do not leave our luggage there and that the porter puts it away in the the back. It was never put away, I finally had to take it and babysit it myself. In every common area of the hotel the furniture was old, stained, and material ripped and/or heavily freyed. The overall feel of the hotel was unwelcoming. I was very embarrassed that I had booked this hotel for my wife and business partner and his wife. Anyone who would rate this hotel a 5 is delusional. Rating it a 3 is a Gift.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Barcellona”
Reviews.Author: silvia s
Reviews.Content: Hesperia Fira Suites was a surprise for us, we booked just a week before departure and we really dind't know how could be staying there. Fortunately was a beutifull place!. The flat was really nice, design furnishing, all comforts included. Peacefull place to stay, a bit far from city center, infact you may need a car or a taxi but it's quite closest to the metro station.The position of Hesperia (quite near the motorway) is good also if you want to spend a day in the beaches near Barcelona, like Sitges. In this way you can mix your cultural holiday with some sun hours in a nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Great value outside the city”
Reviews.Author: Jepe2
Reviews.Content: The suite was very nice. A little kitchen was included, however not very useful if you are going to spend your days visiting Barcelona. You are connected to the city via the metro (subway) on the red line. The good thing is that it is the stop on the red line but still in zone 1. You can get a 10 trip pass that can be shared or other types depending on how long you'll stay. This way of travelling is very economical. The downside is that you can find it a bit far but, I thought the value outweighted this inconvenient. The metro stop is Hospitalet de Bellvitge.

Reviews.Title: “WOW... just perfect for its budget!”
Reviews.Author: ColombiaJuanSe
Reviews.Content: To tell you the truth, eventhough it's a bit far from downtown Barcelona, I found this hotel to be just what anyone needs there. I had been to barcelona before and the hotels downtown where sometimes a bit noisy for my taste. Since the Hesperia has free shuttles to/from the airport and to downtown, it's not difficult to get to the main attractions. Just try to be at the hotel entrance 10 minutes before the hour so you can be sure you're going to find a spot in the shuttle (specially if traveling with more than one couple). Breakfast... SUPER! Wow, one of the best I've found worldwide, no kidding. The rooms, at the suites, are very spacious and having a small studio concept is very convinient. Fully equipped kitchen, two flat screen TV sets, a small living room and a big bathroom, made our 5-day stay a "would go back" experience. I highly recommend this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mzjuniebug
Reviews.Content: This place is more like having an apartment than a hotel room. The price seemed fair for the amenities offered. We did not have a car and for the most part, I doubt most travelers staying a couple nights would need one. Pros: A separate bedroom, living/seating area and a kitchen with a table. Room service available 24 hours. Nice balcony if you want to sit/eat outside. More than adequate a/c. Fantastic shower - that thing had more bells and whistles than I cared to figure out, but my husband loved it Free airport shuttle with a separate area for luggage - and it left right on time for our early morning flight. Cons: 24 hour room service menu is very limited and we did not really see other choices in the area for eating. You decide pro/con: Some people would consider the 10 minute metro ride to the city/action a con, but we found it a plus. It was cheap, easy and since it's the beginning of the line - you always get a seat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suites not far away from Barcelona Airport”
Reviews.Author: oxxyalmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. You get an apartment with a bed room and a living room which includes a small kitchen. Breakfast is not included and it is pretty expensive. Rooms are clean and were cleaned up every day. Wifi signal in our room was very poor but internet is for free. Location is very good if you want to stay close to the airport but if you want to visit the city every day like we did, it takes 40 min to get there. But the metro station is 5 min walk from the hotel. Close to the hotel is a supermarket so everything can be bought there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: WinstonHouston
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at this lovely hotel and suites. The rooms were so comfortable we could have stayed in bed all day. Don't worry about the location. It's in a nice area of Barcelona with easy connections by subway to anywhere you want to go. Staff was terrific, fluent in English and very helpful! We enjoyed the breakfast buffet, finding the price reasonable for all the high quality food you get. With the very reasonable price you'll pay here, you'll have more money left to spend in beautiful Barcelona. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value, but......”
Reviews.Author: AlexRJ
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value, especially as booked as a Mystery Hotel on LastMinute (though it was pretty easy to guess which hotel it was!) - £46/night suite only, plus 10 Euros for v good buffet breakfast (for which you have to walk 1 minute outside to the hotel next door) Summary: Roomy suite - large lounge diner with spacious bedroom and trendy bathroom - all very modern in black and other dark colours. Poor location. Nowhere near the hotel to go to eat (note: there is a petrol station about 200 metres away, for cheap water, beer, etc) Annoying Bits: The only mirror I could find in the suite is a huge mirrored wall in the bathroom above the sink area - the lighting is poor (too poor for shaving and there is no lighted shaving mirror), this mirror gets completely steamed up if you have a bath or shower You can have EITHER a suite with a Bath (all suites come with very nifty showers with multiple nozzles) OR a smoking suite - you CANNOT have a smoking suite WITH a bath! (Note: the bath is very small - half size and narrow, not too brilliant if you are 6ft and an ex-prop forward) The shower head is fixed height at 6ft 1inches.... I had to bend my knees to have a shower! No kettle in room (though you can boil a pan of water on the hob to make yourself a coffee - however you must take your own coffee with you!) TV has five channels - ALL Spanish. No English news/BBC/CNN etc No Express Check-Out (eg have to queue in the morning) No Room Service Breakfast (there is a limited Room Service which is only from midnight to 6am) Breakfast (buffet) starts at 7am, no earlier (btw - breakfast was superb) Have to check in at the main hotel, and then walk back outside and along the pavement to get to the suites block Elevators in the main hotel (you need to use them to get to the breakfast restaurant) are very difficult to use (I had to explain them to 5 or 6 different people), they have a trendy touch screen system (think Star Trek) that probably sounds clever in concept, but is actually not very practical Big pool and Gym - 8 Euros/day/person Though the staff are very friendly and accommodating they are VERY SLOW (my Spanish friends tell me this is a cultural thing....) Location is MILES away from anywhere, and no public transport that I could discover - its about 5km from the airport (not on the flightpath) and a whopping 40 Euros taxi ride from the centre of town Restaurant is quite good but very expensive for Spain (because you are stuck miles away from civilisation, they have you over a barrel if you are hungry....) - 35 Euros for: water, a starter of grilled vegetables, and a fancy salmon sandwich. Food was great, service was excellent, but prices very high

Reviews.Title: “I shall return!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle055
Reviews.Content: Spotless, quiet, comfortable with a fully equiped kitchen and sitting area, convenient to metro with a complimentary breakfast buffet that is indeed something to write home about! The only drawback is that the city is a 10-minute metro ride away, but this particular metro stop is the starting point for the line, so you always have a seat when you board! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you're okay not being close to La Ramblas!”
Reviews.Author: Pinkeggs
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I were travelling together in June and we stayed at Hesperia Fira. It is a beautiful hotel, we had our own suite which had a kitchen, trendy bathroom, televesion and couch area and bedroom. Definitely much bigger than we needed. The value was great becuse we weren't staying close to La Ramblas, but this hotel is litterally a 2 min walk from a metro stop! The metro passes are cheap so it's a great way to get around!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: terrijay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the night before a cruise and it was booked as part of the package so we didn't know what to expect. From the moment we arrived we had a warm, friendly welcome and following check-in, a bell-boy took our cases to our suite in the next building. The suite was well equipped with everything we needed. The kitchenette was good and if we had stayed longer we definately would have used it. I was happy there was a hair-dryer there too. The whole place had a modern feel and it was very close to a metro station so we got to La Ramblas easily. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous apartment!”
Reviews.Author: lemaCheT
Reviews.Content: I loved this apartment. Wish I owned one just like it... only one drawback, and that was the shower, which wasn't completely horrible... It had several different settings and good water pressure, however it changed temperature on it's own quite a bit and the bottom filled up with water, as it didn't seem to drain very well (this may have just been our shower, though). Other than that the apartment was fantastic. It was wonderful to have a kitchen. No oven, but the stove-top and microwave came in very handy. It would be useful to have a power outlet in the kitchen, though... mainly for toast. (There's a small, but well-stocked supermarket 5 min walk away). Very comfortable rooms with nice furniture. Amazing air conditioning, which is definitely a necessity in Barcelona. Good wi-fi. Ice machine in the corridor was a plus. Sleep quality... bed was good... except we hate it when there's two mattresses stuck together! Nice pillows. The bed actually had a top sheet!!! We haven't seen this anywhere else in Europe, and we really appreciate it. The only real drawback for sleep was that the curtains didn't block out light extremely well, but no major issues with this. Far from the centre, but the metro is very close, quick and cheap. Buy a T-10 ticket (10 trips), it has the best value of all metro tickets and you can even share it between several people. The hesperia tower also offers a free shuttle. Very convenient if you want to leave when it's leaving, but it only runs one way, and only around 6 times a day, with a gap between 12:20pm and 6pm... at least those were the times when we were there. Saves you some rides on your metro ticket, though, which is always a plus. If you want to use the fitness centre/swimming pool in the tower you're welcome to do this, but remember it costs 12 euro each per day. We personally found this a little steep.

Reviews.Title: “would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: m10_10
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Clean, spacious, aircon, very quiet at night. We were worried about how far from the centre the apartment was but it turned out to be a great choice. The L1 metro is just accross the roundabout in the hospital car park and straight to centre in aircon carriage in 20 mins. We got 5 day travlecard which gave us unlimited travel in Barca for €25. Worth it as we went all over the place hopping on and off metros and coming home for a siesta as it was so hot. Also a T-10 ticket is good value. Metro is really easy to use and change lines, very frequent just check end times- late friday and all night sat night. Theres a shop and bakeries behind the apartments accross the road so we had breakfast and lunch in every day. maybe bring a sponge and some fairy liquid and cooking oil! The staff were very helpful and spoke great english. For info-one night we missed the last metro back and were about to get a €40 cab back when we found the N17 night bus for €1.40. The bus leaves from a stop just off the top left corner (looking at a map) of place catalunya. make sure you press to stop at the petrol station on the motorway next to the hotel tower. Location got 4 stars as it was perfect for us to get away from it all at the end of the day or siesta but might not be everyones cup of tea! 46 bus from or to airport will be much cheaper than the €25 10minute taxi ride! You'll see the hotel tower near the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Apartment”
Reviews.Author: rbsimmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 05/07/10 – 08/07/10 We stayed in the suites not the Tower. Both are 5 star. I would say Apartment would be 4- 4.5 star. Very clean and spacious. We had a 2 bedroom apartment on the 3rd floor, Room 311. There is only 3 floors at the Suites. You need to book in at the Tower not the suites. Parking is underneath in the car park. Costs €24.00 per 24hours. We got a good deal direct with hotel. €222.00 for 3 nights not including parking. Apartments are decorated in black granite and light & dark wood. Queen size bed in 1 room and a single in the 2nd bedroom. Bathroom is huge, with a huge power shower with massage jets. Apartment is air conditioned, with plasma TV with English Channel - Sky News. Kitchen has a cook top with 2 elements, under bench fridge, toaster microwave, coffee machine but bare essentials for cooking with. Minimal cutlery and plates etc as the house keeping wash everything for you. Our only complaint is that it seemed housekeeping only washes dishes and cutlery etc under hot water as food and oil was still visible on plates and pans after they were left to dry. There is no tea towels or dish cloths or detergent for you to do this or even a cloth to wipe the bench from spills etc so we had to use the bathroom hand towels for this. There is a 4 seat dining table and separate lounge area. Free wifi in the apartment. Metro is a 3 minute walk across the road and trough a car park, and the train into Catalunya station takes 15-20 minutes and costs €1.40 one way. There is a grocery store right around the corner for food and essentials; also they provide a free shuttle into Barcelona city centre but not a return ride. Timetable for this free shuttle services is available at the reception. Staff are very helpful and fluent in English. Great place overall to stay just in the outskirts of Barcelona in a business district. Nothing really around her to see that is touristy but like I said it is close to the Metro. Would definitely highly recommend this accommodation and would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Best of both worlds, lovely relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: au_contraire
Reviews.Content: The Hesperia Hotel is just next to the 'Fira Suites' building (we had to check in/out at the reception there as they don't have one manned in the fira suites building out of season, but it's no trouble as it's right next to it. We found our room to be of a high standard and very clean, a sort of 'living area' with a mini kitchen and a table to eat at, with a tv and sofa, the bedroom and bathroom both leading off it. It was really nice to be able to buy our own food and cook for ourselves some evenings, but because it's a hotel and not self catering, you get your washing up done for you the next day :). On the first night we arrived late and had room service and drank from the mini bar (not too horrendously priced). There was a very fancy shower with water spraying from here there and everywhere, nice if you like that sort of thing but i'm more of a bath person!! We didn't really deal much with the staff other than checking in and out as we tend to keep to ourselves but they all seemed polite and spoke good english. The location was an ideal base for exploring the city with a metro station just over the road, there are a few shops nearby but nothing much of interest in the district where the hotel is, so remember when you get back to the hotel that's where you'll stay! Overall we found the Fira suites to be a great place to explore beautiful Barcelona from, i really enjoyed coming back to our nice apartment after a long day of walking around the city!! highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “First class one bedroom suite for less than the cost of a studio downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn_Gerry
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to be helpful. It was a great hotel, the suite was a good size. It was nice to have the kitchen area to make tea and some small meals. There wasn't a coffee maker or kettle, but we made to with a pot to boil the water. There is a free shuttle from the airport available, we requested the schedule by email before our arrival. The shuttle also runs into Barcelona a number of times each day, you need to get yourself back to the hotel. We used the metro more than the shuttle, it's only a short distance away. We purchased a T-10 ticket for just under 8 Euros and shared it, so found the metro fast, easy and inexpensive. We don't do late nights, so didn't mind being out of the downtown area. There is a small shopping area just behind the hotel, with a supermarket, bakery, sandwich shop and a couple of bars.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suites! Bad thermostat, though. And don't rely on Google maps to get you here.”
Reviews.Author: jameygamer
Reviews.Content: I loved being here. First of all, the Hesperia Fira Suites is adjacent to the Hesperia Tower hotel, so you check in there and get access to it's stuff, including a fantastic ground floor cafe with a yummy entrecote steak, and a Michelin-starred top floor restaurant, EVO, which I didn't try, unfortunantly. The suites are great. They are very roomy, with comfy beds, good decor and a great shower, though the AC never went below 22 degrees Celsius, which kinda was a problem for me, but I still liked it a lot. It's also close to the airport, and so this is a great choice for people who are flying. I highly recommend this hotel. My only regret was that Google Maps gave us the wrong directions to this hotel, so we did get lost trying to look for it, and almost gave up looking. So do NOT use Google maps looking for this place. Overall, this is a great hotel, and a fun place to stay, so give it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “excellent if you don't want to be downtown late at night, but some minor weaknesses”
Reviews.Author: peterjames2000
Reviews.Content: Firstly, clarification - the suites are a separate building very close to the main tower where all admin is conducted so go there first. It is very much a business hotel and so impersonal. Many pluses: 1) The free shuttles to Barcelona centre and airport are very good, former enabling a full day in town and then return for suite cooked dinner in the evening (NB previous review incorrect - you can get the shuttle back from downtown but it finishes around 10 pm; the airport shuttle runs to a schedule - posted on the hotel web site but only the Spanish PDF downloads; hotel says it is starting a third shuttle to the beach in summer; shuttle to Plaza Catalunya takes 15 minutes in light traffic. 2) There are a number of shops - supermarket, fruit and veg, pharmacy; bakeries - and bars less than 100 metres/yards away in a square (walk down wide road in opposite direction to the hotel for just a few yards and look right to see a sign for the first of these shops - either walk right here or carry on a few yards for a wider approach, which is probably best at night (NB an earlier review mentioned social housing - correct but think ordinary working people rather than dysfunctional) 3) Suites themselves spacious and comfortable - good beds and reasonably equipped. e.g. 2 hot plates and a microwave for cooking. The downsides other than location are: 1) Very poor (even by Spanish standards) choice of English channels on TV - e.g. no BBC 2) Missing essentials (especially if you're used to American suites) - nothing to wash or dry dishes with, and now no in room coffee for the Nespresso machine (has to be purchased in main hotel at 0.7 euros a pop). 3) 12 euro fee for the pool/spa - though to be fair this is a separate facility (Metropolitan Spa) which Googling suggests is a level above the typical hotel facility

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cuddlemuffin
Reviews.Content: Check in for the suites is inside the hotel next door and not a problem. We were directed to the hotel by the security guard at the suites.(There is also a sign on the door explaining what to do) Check in was quick and efficient and we found the staff helpful.We then found our room. The room was very clean,with a kitchen area pretty well equipped with everything you may need if you were catering for yourself.The separate bedroom was very comfortable with plenty of storage.The bathroom was also very clean with a very nice shower/wetroom.The only downside was the shower tray did tend to fill up with water when having a shower and we noticed that the corridor smelt a bit of 'drains'. However we had a nice stay here although it was only for two days.It is away from the town centre and a taxi to the centre cost us 17 euros. The airport is closer however the taxis will charge a minimum of 20 Euros to and from the airport.We didnt have breakfast in the hotel because a two minute walk away are some shops, a well equipped supermarket and three bakeries where you can pick up something for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Cant see how people complain!”
Reviews.Author: Gemma_Fisher3005
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights for sightseeing and leisure and I could not find anything to complain about with this hotel! Yes as others say it isn't in the centre of Barcelona, but the metro is opposite and you can be in Catalunya within half an hour and down to the beach within 45 minutes (with one change over) The hotel is in a nice quite area, there are a few shops and cafes about, so not totally dead as others suggest - and several supermarkets which supply everything you need to fill your fridge. The staff were very polite and speak fairly good English - the shuttle is a brilliant way to get around for free, however it does only run at certain times, but the timetable is displayed in the lobby & the staff at reception are only at the end of the phone for any questions. The rooms are beautiful! To keep in theme with the rest of the hotel they're modern and lovely to look at. Within the room you get a small kitchen area with hobs, all kitchen equipment, dining table, sofa, 2 LCD TV’s, a comfy double bed, wardrobes, safe, mini bar, coffee making facilities, iron and ironing board, bathroom with the best shower ever! fresh clean towels every day, hairdryer and air conditioning. So everything you could need! We had breakfast included in our stay, this again was very good. It didn’t have the widest spread of food but it had more than enough - cereal, bread, and pastries, fresh fruit, meats, yoghurts and drinks. And again the staff were always polite. We didn't try any of the other menu's offered at the hotel, but for no other reason than we were out till late most nights and as you would expect the centre offers much more variety. **TIPS** - As we expected we had to travel to get around, but this wasn't any hassel at all, transfers to the airport are about 20euro's, but do say to the taxi driver on the way hesperia tower (not many know of the suites) - Buy a T-10 it really does save you a lot of money and its easy enough to use (if your travelliing with a partner/others and aren't planning on using the metro much you can just buy one ticket between you) - If buying souvenirs, go to La Rambla but shop around as the gift shops towards the port are much cheaper than the ones closer to Catalunya - The zoo is really worth going to! (it looks a little run down outside but it is open) - The room includes a book called 'The Style' READ IT! it has everything you need to know in it, places to eat, things to do, where to shop, maps!! - Bus tours seem a good way to get around, but can be done on your own just as easy - Check in at the hotel isn't until 2, but you can leave your bags and come back if you arrive before hand - There is a gym and pool, but it does include a surcharge I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is going sightseeing or wants somewhere a little quieter. Just look up the hotel and metro's before you go

Reviews.Title: “yes and no”
Reviews.Author: davidepietro
Reviews.Content: 15 euro far from barcellona center. there is a differece between the tower hesperia and the residence... no concierge in the residence you must go to the hotel to get the key... you cant make breakfast at the hotel even if you pay.... if you go to eat at the last floor of the hotel it will cost you 135 euro each no drinks...but the food is quite good. you can access only if you eat... if you dont they will kick you out quite rudly.....has it happens to us.... there is no air circulation in the residence and there was a bad smell
